BreakpointPathlossModel.cc

00001 #include "BreakpointPathlossModel.h"
00002 
00003 #include "AirFrame_m.h"
00004 
00005 #define debugEV (ev.isDisabled()||!debug) ? ev : ev << "PhyLayer(BreakpointPathlossModel): "
00006 
00007 
00008 void BreakpointPathlossModel::filterSignal(AirFrame *frame, const Coord& sendersPos, const Coord& receiverPos) {
00009   Signal& signal = frame->getSignal();
00010 
00012   double distance = useTorus ? receiverPos.sqrTorusDist(sendersPos, playgroundSize)
00013                   : receiverPos.sqrdist(sendersPos);
00014   distance = sqrt(distance);
00015   debugEV << "distance is: " << distance << endl;
00016 
00017   if(distance <= 1.0) {
00018     //attenuation is negligible
00019     return;
00020   }
00021 
00022   double attenuation = 1;
00023   // PL(d) = PL0 + 10 alpha log10 (d/d0)
00024   // 10 ^ { PL(d)/10 } = 10 ^{PL0 + 10 alpha log10 (d/d0)}/10
00025   // 10 ^ { PL(d)/10 } = 10 ^ PL0/10 * 10 ^ { 10 log10 (d/d0)^alpha }/10
00026   // 10 ^ { PL(d)/10 } = 10 ^ PL0/10 * 10 ^ { log10 (d/d0)^alpha }
00027   // 10 ^ { PL(d)/10 } = 10 ^ PL0/10 * (d/d0)^alpha
00028   if(distance < breakpointDistance) {
00029     attenuation = attenuation * PL01_real;
00030     attenuation = attenuation * pow(distance, alpha1);
00031   } else {
00032     attenuation = attenuation * PL02_real;
00033     attenuation = attenuation * pow(distance/breakpointDistance, alpha2);
00034   }
00035   attenuation = 1/attenuation;
00036   debugEV << "attenuation is: " << attenuation << endl;
00037 
00038   if(debug) {
00039     pathlosses.record(10*log10(attenuation)); // in dB
00040   }
00041 
00042   //const DimensionSet& domain = DimensionSet::timeDomain;
00043   Argument arg; // default constructor initializes with a single dimension, time, and value 0 (offset from signal start)
00044   TimeMapping<Linear>* attMapping = new TimeMapping<Linear> (); // mapping performs a linear interpolation from our single point -> constant
00045   attMapping->setValue(arg, attenuation);
00046 
00047   /* at last add the created attenuation mapping to the signal */
00048   signal.addAttenuation(attMapping);
00049 }
